results.title: Meeting in session
results.creator_credit: Columbia University Teahcer's College Bureau of Publications and Josef Bohmer
results.brief_description: Glimpses of a variety of meetings - a school faculty, a high school committee, a business men’s session, a committee of nurses - illustrate the fact that most of us work in groups from time to time. Two contrasting session are presented, as a small group of nurses attempts to solve the problem of adequate staffing for the hospital four to twelve shift. In each meeting the problem and the participants are the same. The differences are in general approach, attitude displayed, techniques used and results achieved. In the first meeting participants enact negative roles characteristic of individuals intent on their own feelings and problems. The supervisor is an impatient administrator; head nurses demand rigid interpretation of present rules. In the second meeting nurses assume the roles of co-operative group members interested in desirable solutions and sympathetically aware of each other’s feelings. Each member contributes, and her ideas receive thoughtful consideration. At the end the nurse-recorder sums up suggestions, and each person volunteers for work on one or more specific proposals.

results.title: Meeting in Progress
results.creator_credit: Roundtable Productions, Leon S. Gold and Arthur Swerdloff
results.brief_description: This is a management training film that looks at the role of a conference leader who is responsible for the ultimate achievement of the purpose of the meeting. The realistic setting for the film is a staff meeting led by a department manager and attend by other staff members. This fictional meeting demonstrates critical points typical of any meeting and it gives solutions.

results.title: Meet your Federal Government
results.brief_description: This film gives a detailed description of how the US Federal Government operates and a brief description of the meaning of such government to the citizens of the United Sates. Discusses the purpose and function of the three main branches of government; the Capitol or legislative branch; the White House or executive branch and the Supreme Court or judicial branch. Discusses the system of checks and balances which exists between these branches of government.

results.title: Meet Tisani
results.brief_description: Tsani, a Thai public health nurse, brings health care to families living along the canals in and around Bangkok. Her story illustrates the new role women are placing in solving basic publics health problems and in speeding Thai national development.

results.title: Meet the Ship
results.brief_description: A Petty Officer introduces a recruit to a cruiser of the Royal Navy. As they walk around the ship the Officer, an old salt, gives the recruit an impression of life at sea in peace and war. The structure, equipment and armament of the vessel are examined in detail and there is incidental information on some naval traditions.

results.title: Meet the Midland
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions, Midlands Bank, Humphrey Swingler and Daniel Ingram
results.brief_description: An account of everyday business conducted by one of Britain’s leading banks. Activities are illustrated through a series of stories woven around different clients and their problems. In this way, sequences describe many of the facilities offered by the bank - including general cheque clearing services; deposit and loan accounts for individuals and business houses, and specialised assistance given by the overseas trade promotion department.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greenpark Productions, Midlands Bank, Humphrey Swingler and Daniel Ingram

results.title: Meet the chief
results.creator_credit: Swift Films, Boy Scouts Association (Great Britain) and Peter Hadingham
results.brief_description: The Chief Scout, Sir Charles MacLean, in his home on the Isle of Mull. He is shown entertaining three Scouts and showing them over the castle where his ancestors have lived for centuries. The 1960 march past of Queen’s Scouts before Her Majesty at Windsor Castle; the Chief Scout’s speech on that occasion. Finally, a message from him to the Scouts of the Commonwealth.

results.title: Meet the author: Elizabeth Jolley
results.brief_description: Elizabeth Jolley was born in England and migrated to Western Australia in 1959 with her husband and three children. Elizabeth has held many different occupations throughout her lifetime; writing being one of the more passionate ones. Elizabeth, interviewed by Linda Jeffery and Mark Buckeridge discusses her attitude to writing, how characters are created and the mechanics of writing a novel. Aimed at years 10-12. No other production details available.

results.title: Meet me in Las Vegas
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Joe Pasternak and Roy Rowland
results.brief_description: While vacationing in Las Vegas with his mother, a wealthy Nevada rancher meets a ballet dancer who brings him luck at the roulette wheel. Shot on location in the renowned Sands Hotel, the film captures the glitz and glamour of the neon-lit gamblers’ paradise in its martini-era prime and features numerous cameo appearances by famous actors and Las Vegas entertainers including Frank Sinatra, Paul Henreid, Lena Horne, Frankie Laine and Peter Lorre. A song and dance highlight, featuring Cyd Charisse, is the thirteen minute bop parody of the ballad ‘Frankie and Johnny’ with special lyrics by Sammy Cahn sung by Sammy Davis Jr. Other songs include ‘The Gal With The Yaller Shoes’, ‘If You Can’t Dream’, ‘My Lucky Charm’, ‘Hell Hath No Fury’, ‘I Refuse To Rock ‘N Roll’
